value: This is a lovely area on the coast north of

.  As the name implies the region is dotted with numerous tiny islands.  Some have beaches to which you can charter a boat.  Typically the boat will leave you for several hours on your own private beach.

Boats can be caught at the "Lucap" wharf, which is 5 kilometres away from the city of Alaminos (which is where the buses terminate).

See the travel section below regarding how to reach here
There are many cities in the province of Pangasinan. They are:

value: is the main city of Pangasinan. There are several malls, CSI: The City Mall and Nepo Mall being the most popular.

is tops in finance not only in Pangasinan but the entire Ilocos region. Because of this, Urdaneta in only it's 9th year of cityhood is being eyed for upgrade to 1st class city status, the first in region 1 beating older cities like Dagupan. There are also several malls here, including Magic Mall, CB Mall & CSI. SM Prime Holdings has a 15.6 hectare lot in this city for its future mall. Urdaneta is home to the largest cattle market north of Manila & the largest

, the Mango and Bamboo Capital of the Philippines, is Pangasinan's most historic political unit as well as its cultural capital. The city dresses up in green and yellow every April when it celebrates the Mango-Bamboo Festival, a festival that showcases not only delicious mangoes and durable bamboo handicrafts but the best San Carlos City has to offer.
Most Pangasinenses residing in central Pangasinan speak the
language. Their language is erroneously known by other Filipinos as
is spoken in the western and especially the eastern side of Pangasinan.
Many establishments use the national language known as
is widely-spoken in the province especially by the youth.

There is no airport serving Pangasinan. So, if you are coming from Manila, you are likely to take the bus. Victory liner runs buses every hour from Manila to Alaminos. These buses pass via Dau and Tarlac. If you have a car, you can take NLEX (North Luzon Express Way). If you are willing to spend a lot of money, taxis can also drive you to Pangasinan.

value: http://hundredislandsphilippines.blogspot.com/view/sidebar#!/2012/02/my-trip-to-hundred-islands-day-1-manila.html Click here for a detailed account on how to reach Alaminos

Once you reach Alaminos (which is a moderate sized city, with the mandatory Jollybee!),
. Lucap is about 5 kilometres away and the gateway to Hundred islands.

value: Boats (bangka) can then be taken from Lucap wharf

- they are available aplenty. Hiring a bangka for the whole day costs about 1500 pesos - the itinerary can be charted by you - you can point to any beach and stay / snorkel there.

value: is a large church located in the town of Manaoag. It houses the "Our Lady of Manaoag" which is believed to grant wishes and miracles. Many Filipinos visit the church as pilgrims.
is a shrine located in front of St. Peter and Paul's Parish in the town of Calasiao, Pangasinan. Inside is a statue of Jesus nailed on his cross. It is the second pilgrimage site in the province.

name=Go island hopping and Snorkeling in Hundred islands

content=Island hopping is an absolute must. The snorkeling here is fine - the marine creatures colourful. There are sergeants, barracudas, zebra fish, cardinal fish, butterfly and angel fish, parrot fish and puffer / box fish. The water tends to be warm so a wet / dry suit is not needed. Lifejackets are available in the boat for non swimmers, but anyway the water depth is between 30 cms to 2 metres only in most spots.

content=A more upmarket restaurant, with a view of Hundred islands from it's restaurant. Located 3 minutes walk from Lucap wharf. Also offers rooms from 3000 PHP.

content=Costing 2000 pesos, these nipa huts are plain, simple, with bed and electricity (only 6 pm to 6 am). CRs are common and outside

content=Mediterranean-style mansion villas and Filipino Bahay Kubo equipped with air-conditioning, cable TV, and private toilet and bath with hot/ cold water, bidet, and complete bathroom amenities. Some of its facilities and services are pool bar, outdoor Jacuzzi and swimming pool.
content=The hotel's location is very clean. It is only minutes away from downtown Dagupan and CSI: The City Mall.
content=Along the road of Manaoag-Binalonan/Pozorubio-Baguio. It is only minutes away from downtown Manaoag.
name=Star Plaza Hotel. Value star inn.
directions=Value star inn is behide the star plaza hotel.

content=Star Plaza Hotel and Value star inn are in downtown Dagupan. The restaurant serves a wide range of delicious food. Value star inn and Star plaza hotel have the same owner. single/double fan/a/c rooms with own bathrooms.

content=Villa Antolin is a 20-room hotel located near the Hundred Islands National Park. The hotel offers boat ride services to go to the islands and explore the beaches of Hundred Islands. The hotel can be used for banquets and special events.
